name: power block installation, solar thermal parabolic trough, 50 MW | power block, solar thermal parabolic trough, 50 MW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18326/documentation

This activity represents the construction of a power block unit for a 50MW solar thermal parabolic trough plant in South Africa, Upington.  The main components are pressure vessels, compressors, heat exchangers with cooling towers, steam turbine generators etc. ;This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by ;Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany. 

The activity starts with the assembly of all needed components of the power block. 

The activity concludes when the solar power plant is decomissioned.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The CSP plant represented in this dataset has been modelled specifically for South African conditions (see Telsnig 2015).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Condensate - 2* 100 %, 4025 gpm, 335 ft tdh, 114 °F, 450 bhp motor, 4.16 kV 1750rpm, multi-stage vertical turbine, mounted in below-grade cans;Comprises of air compressors, vacuum pumps, air exhauster;;Steam Turbine - 2 cylinder (HP and LP/LP), downward exhaust 265 Mwe, 1800 rpm, 1465 psia / 703 F / 703F, 2.5 in.HgA exhaust 2340000 lb/hr main steam flow rate;Generator - 2 pole, air cooled, 294 MVA, 0.9 lagging power factor 13.8 kV, 12300 A each phase
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The original data modelling a 250 MW power plant have been scaled down with parameter specific linear and non-linear equations to represent a 50 MW plant design.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by 
Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany. 

Further, data in Telsnig 2015 are not shown explicitely for the downscaled 50 MW parabolic trough power plant. This gap is filled in the ecoinvent report.

exchanges.description: Reference product unit of a power block installation unit for a 50MW solar thermal parabolic trough plant

flow.name: power block, solar thermal parabolic trough, 50 MW

exchanges.description:
All steel types are assumed to be treated as reinforcing steel due to lack of other appropriate datasets in ecoinvent.  Further included are zinc, brass and molybdenum.
For the time period 2003-2012, average steel recycling rate in South Africa amounted to 35% fo the total steel mass according to Telsnig 2015. The remaining steel is assumed to be sent to final disposal.

exchanges.description:
All steel types are assumed to be treated as reinforcing steel due to lack of other appropriate datasets in ecoinvent.  Further included are zinc, brass and molybdenum.
For the time period 2003-2012, average steel recycling rate in South Africa amounted to 35% fo the total steel mass according to Telsnig 2015. The remaining steel is assumed to be sent to final disposal.
